ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This was an amazing course. I think about not just child care, but also how I can contribute to improving the child care landscape, much more deeply. I have a profound admiration for this course and the instructors who teach it. Thank you for working to improve our child care landscape and inspiring students to make a difference in the future!
Child care policy and how the U.S. education system is failing the youngest and most vulnerable population! Very important
I learned SO MUCH about child care in the United States. This is a topic that simply goes undiscussed, and I'm really glad I have a handle on how necessary it is to care about it.
Understanding of early childhood education issues
I learned all about the child care options in the United States and the changes we hope to incorporate in the future.
Learned a lot about the child care system around issues of economics, equity, and policy!

This seminar is a great space for exploring the challenges around childcare and early childhood education in the United States. Each week's theme dives into the importance of expanding student-centered and family-centered childcare and early childhood education programs and the challenges associated with them. This was a starting point for me in this aspect of education, so this course was really well-designed to get a vast breadth of the societal and policy landscape

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The discussion-based nature of this course is amazing! It could not be improved. I loved the units and professors!
I enjoyed the flexibility with class discussions

This course truly was a family for me, and this was very special. I felt safe and welcome among my classmates. The assignments were a lot of fun, and I liked how much they varied. The activities we completed too were a lot of fun and reminded me of the creativity that should go into this work!

The readings were a little bit repetitive. It may be worth cutting a few out or replacing them with non-policy ones. Also, I would really appreciate more guidance on the assignments! Having a page on Canvas that explained the expectations for them would be really helpful!
fantastic teachers, fantastic classmates, discussions felt repetitive
I loved this course. The professors were fantastic and everyone was clearly there because they are passionate about children and equitable care.
The professors are amazing! It doesnt get better that them. Really great balance of seminar and lecture, and also, the day-to-day activities helped our class grow closer together. Brava!

The course is a great overview of early childhood education and childcare in the U.S. The combination of student-led discussion questions, brief concept overview, and activities made the 110 minutes of class purposeful and engaging. One suggestion to improve the course is to have more structured check-ins for the final paper earlier in the semester. The final paper is a great assignment for self-initiated research into a topic we did not go too much into depth in class (or bring new ideas to concepts we reviewed), but one structured meeting may not be enough to get the ball rolling.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: ABSOLUTELY! This was among my favorite classes at Yale! I am leaving with a perspective on the crucial need to improve early childhood landscape and feel empowered to do so!
Yes!
Absolutely!

Definitely, Jess and Janna are phenomenal people to learn from. They have so much knowledge to share and so much passion. The course itself is engaging and makes learning about this topic that much more worthwhile. I felt very cared for and supported throughout this class!

Highly recommend! You learn a ton about childcare and early childhood education, and both Janna and Jessica have decades of experience working in early childhood education. There's time set aside to explore some solutions/approaches to some issues on childcare, which make for very interesting conversations and discussions.
ABSOLUTELY! Phenomenal classroom environment.
Yes, absolutely. It is a joyful class despite the topics being heavy at times.
100% Very supportive yet engaging environment! Best professors.
Most definitely if you are interested in early childhood education, teaching, and/or childcare system in the U.S. By far, one of my favorite seminars within Education Studies and Yale overall.
